result.execSummary:
The defendant Connie S. Sczygelski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Attempting Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Connie S. Sczygelski in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is requesting a late date to report to jail.  Court grants the request and amends the report date to 1/12/15 @ 9:00 am
Associated with Charge #1

Not to own or possess any firearms.  Ineligible voting notice & acknowledgement.  New probation case form.  Submit DNA sample if not previously submitted.  Notice of right to seek post conviction relief.

Defendant Connie S. Sczygelski in court with attorney James A. Wedemeyer.  Donald James Dunphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft enters a plea of no contest to Count 1 in 14CF60 other counts are DRI, Deft enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1 in 14CT12 and Count 2 - DRI.  14TR331 and 14TR332 are dismissed and read into 14CF60.
  Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders:
14CF60 - Count 1
24 months probation w/held
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.
10 day jail w/huber on or before 1/5/15 9:00 am
During STAY no alcohol, taverns or bars
6 months DL revoked

14CT12 - Count 1
$1,064 fine.
5 days jail w/huber concurrent to 14CF60 (same start date at 14CF60)
During stay no alcohol, taverns or bars.
12 month DL revoked
AODA assessment and treatment w/any followup
Pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court orders that for a period of 12 months, beginning on _1/2/15, each motor vehicle for which the defendant's name appears on the vehicle's certificate of title or registration be equipped with an ignition interlock device.

Also, pursuant to the provisions of Section 343.301, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the Court further orders that for a period of 12 months, beginning on the date the Department of Transportation issues any license to the defendant granted under Ch. 343, of the Wisconsin Statutes, the defendant's operating privileges for the operation of Class D vehicles be restricted to operating vehicles that are equipped with an ignition interlock device.

14TR331 and 14TR332 are dismissed and read into 14CF60.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
